Comment: We move our king's pawns to free our queens and kingside bishops...
We move our king's pawns to free our queens and kingside bishops...
...and I develop my knight to attack his pawn...
...and I remove his bishop, with the knight there as a shield from the queen.
He moves his queen's pawn to cover its neighbour...
...and he brings up his queen, from with my king is shielded by my knight...
...so now I contest the centre with my queen's pawn.
...allowing me to bring up my queen...
...and perform a royal fork on a square controlled by my knight...
...and perform a royal fork on a square controlled by my knight...
...but he moves it out of harm's way.
So now it's the cue for me to bring up my other knight...
...allows me to fork the king and knight...
